channel.title: 2 New Cult Classes
channel.description:
Before everyone screams at me, yes I know that BD keep royal blood when converted into cult but I'd like to make some royal blood cult converts, once you convert a royal into one of these classes you no longer are able to convert them into one of these classes until the royal cult dies
Example: you converted a Princess into a Cultress, you try to convert another Princess into a Cultress she will be a Seeker
[details="Cultress"] > [color=red]The Cultress, Cult, Investigative :mag_right:[/color] > = > Converts from Princess > > Passive 1: Cult Blood: Same as royal blood > > Day Ability 1: Inner Soul: Discover a player's faction, 2 use > > Night Ability 1: Cult Lashes: Discover a player's class type, 4 use > > Night Ability 2: Blood Wisp: Discover if a player is going to protect/heal (merc guard counts) a person, 3 use [/details]
[details="Tippler"] > [color=red]The Tippler (placeholder name), Cult, Offensive :dagger:[/color] > = >Converts from Drunk > > Passive 1: Cult Blood: Same as royal blood > > Passive 2: Mithras Focus: Immune to occupation/target change > > Night Ability 1: Suspicious Drinker: same as debauchery > > Night Ability 2: Blood wine: Chose a player to serve blood wine to, the player will be occ' d going through immunity if BD or neutral because they will get sick at the sight, if he is NK he will not react and do what he does, 2 use [/details]
Noble turns into apostle as usual
Feedback/suggestions are appreciated

item.title: 2 New Cult Classes
item.dc:creator: NOBLE1
item.description:
I like the classes. I do think cult could use some more help. Good job!

Read full topic

item.title: 2 New Cult Classes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Mostly balence reasons. It could be far too powerful to give the cult access to something like that when it is so easy to get access to a Ritualist. Possablely even N1.

This is because you can use it in combination with bleed for a free extra kill. Normally with teleport it is possible to try and predict the swap and still heal the right person, or you can use a CW to help.

Other use cases would be extremely rare.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 New Cult Classes
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
It should just be able to target anyone. Why should it only target the cult?

Read full topic

item.title: 2 New Cult Classes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Also of we are changing the effects of the abilitys for seeker and ritualist then we should set the uses to match

Seeker:
Gaze - 2 uses
Identity - 3 uses

Ritualist:
Teleport - 3 uses
Brotherhood - 2 uses

That is all for now.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 New Cult Classes
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

Brotherhood only affects 2 classes in the game(and the last nerf wasn’t needed. It needed a rework, not a nerf.)

I propose making it work like the enforcers protection and prevent visits to target cultist.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 New Cult Classes
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Firelitten:

Seeker can find good classes to convert while the unseen have to look out for them or get a investigator to find it. And they convert later

Gaze is useful, but identify is only useful for finding neuts. And expose is useless once the prince dies. Gaze should just work like observer’s follow and identify should determine the exact class of your target. Expose should also determine the next player to use a day ability(which would include the prince).

Firelitten:

Apostle-I think this has voting power meaning auto great

Agreed. Apostle is what each cult class should be like.

Firelitten:

Ritualist is THE BEST ONE I THINK IN THE EARLY-mid game.

Hides a member, swaps people

Not really. Teleport is its only useful ability. Brotherhood only affects 2 classes in the game(and the last nerf wasn’t needed. It needed a rework, not a nerf.)

Firelitten:

Um can you remind

Me of the last one?

Invoker(which is one of the better cult classes, though bewilder shouldn’t only target the king and it should have more uses).

Read full topic

item.title: 2 New Cult Classes
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
And I don’t care how you say it

A converter that’s can’t be replace that turns people into Op carbons of their stuff

Will always be outmatched by a converter that can be replaced and only turns people into a cult member without abilities

Read full topic

item.description:
The abilities aren’t weak

Seeker can find good classes to convert while the unseen have to look out for them or get a investigator to find it. And they convert later

Apostle-I think this has voting power meaning auto great

Ritualist is THE BEST ONE I THINK IN THE EARLY-mid game.
Hides a member, swaps people

Um can you remind
Me of the last one?

item.title: 2 New Cult Classes
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Firelitten:

I disagree. The wise man once told me (me making up a quote) that it doesn’t matter if your army is small and strong. You will always lose to a army outnumbering you a lot.

Alright, but the unseen still has more advantages and less disadvantages.

Firelitten:

The cults advantage is number and I disagree with your statement. They have numbers meaning they can cause mislynchs. While the unseen have 3 members and can’t mislynch that often.

That’s their only advantage though.

Firelitten:

Classes being expendable is a great advantage meaning they can lose a member and not have to panic

But they are weak mechanically and boring to play. They should at least be on the same level as apostle.

Firelitten:

Numbers>Abitiles

That doesn’t mean that the abilities should be weak though.

Read full topic

item.description:
RHCube:

Has to sacrifice members to kill more

I disagree. The wise man once told me (me making up a quote) that it doesn’t matter if your army is small and strong. You will always lose to a army outnumbering you a lot.

The cults advantage is number and I disagree with your statement. They have numbers meaning they can cause mislynchs. While the unseen have 3 members and can’t mislynch that often.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 New Cult Classes
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
The cult has too many disadvantages compared to the unseen though.

Unseen advantages:
-Can kill and convert in the same night
-Each class is powerful
-Converting class is immune to death, occupation, and redirection

Unseen disadvantages:
-Once the mastermind is dead, they can no longer convert

Cult advantages:
-Can infinitely convert
-Can have 4 members

Cult disadvantages:
-Has to sacrifice members to kill more
-Killing and converting are shared by the same class
-Classes are expendable

Read full topic

item.description:

And what disadvantage do cult get

Limited use abitlies…

item.description:
Firelitten:

Cult classes are MEANT to be replaced.

That doesn’t mean that they should be weak. The assassin is just as easily replaced, yet the unseen classes are still strong.

Firelitten:

If that wasn’t the Case spy maid would be infinite.

Just because it isn’t doesn’t mean that it shouldn’t be.
